column1: The choleric is someone who brings movement and purpose to the environments they are in. Their leadership ability and desire to achieve goals make them a highly productive and inspiring person. They see life as a series of challenges to be overcome and feel fulfilled by turning difficulties into solutions.
• Enjoys challenges: They are motivated by obstacles and love solving complex problems.
• Quick thinking: They think quickly and have ready answers for almost any situation.
• Practical: They don’t get lost in details
column2: preferring direct actions and quick results.

column1: • Hardworking: They have almost inexhaustible energy and rarely tire of their tasks.
• Natural leader: They take responsibility and lead with confidence
column2: inspiring those around them.

column1: • Assertive and decisive: They are not afraid to make decisions
column2: even in high-pressure situations.

column1: • Expansive: They like to stay active and always seek new achievements.
Despite their qualities
column2: the choleric needs to develop emotional self-control and learn to deal with their limitations. They can become arrogant
column3: believing that only their way of doing things is correct. This attitude often prevents them from admitting mistakes and makes it difficult for them to apologize.

column1: • Impatience: They do not tolerate delays and get easily irritated when things do not happen as they want.
• Arrogance: They may consider themselves superior to others and struggle to listen to different opinions.
• Motivation through criticism: They believe that criticism is the best way to motivate others
column2: which can lead to resentment.

column1: • Interferes without being asked: They often give opinions and advice even when not requested.
• Reluctance to ask for help: Believing themselves self-sufficient
column2: they avoid seeking assistance
column3: even when necessary.

column1: • Difficulty apologizing: They are resistant to admitting mistakes and rarely apologize
column2: believing that showing vulnerability is a sign of weakness.";"

column1: The greatest challenge for the choleric is learning to balance their intensity and recognizing that not all situations require speed and immediate action. They need to work on patience and develop empathy to deal with people who have different paces from their own. Additionally
column2: it is essential for the choleric to learn to listen more and accept advice
column3: understanding that asking for help is not a sign of weakness but of wisdom.

column2: the choleric transforms their intense energy into a positive force
column3: bringing out the best in themselves and others. They become like a well-controlled flame: warming without burning
column4: illuminating without overshadowing. The key to their success lies in transforming their inner fire into a creative and constructive force.

column1: • Practice patience: Breathing exercises or activities that require calm
column2: such as yoga or meditation
column3: can help control their impatience.

column1: • Learn to delegate: Trusting more in the abilities of others can improve their relationships with colleagues and family members.
• Listen more and criticize less: Practicing active listening and offering constructive criticism can make their leadership more effective and empathetic.
• Work on humility: Recognizing their own mistakes and apologizing is a sign of maturity and strengthens personal relationships.
• Seek emotional balance: Finding healthy ways to express anger and frustration will prevent them from hurting the people around them."
